title: Michio Kaku on String Field Theory and the Multiverse
body:
Hang on to your hats because you are about to go on a heck of a ride through time, space and the multiverse. Dr. Michio Kaku has been described as today’s Einstein in many elite circles. Add his genius for comedy and passion for the new frontier of string field theory, of which he is co-founder, and you have a veritable stand up theoretical physicist comedian. 

Dr. Kaku takes subjects that are nearly impossible for our current minds to understand and reduces them to common analogies; bringing incredible and exciting new possibilities for mankind into clearer focus. He is an extremely entertaining speaker who is able to explain enough about quantum physics for the lay person to understand everything about the universe we live in. And you may be shocked how little we have evolved!
teaser: Having a hard enough time dealing with third dimensional life? How about eleven dimensions? Dr. Michio Kaku, co-founder of string field theory, has made it his life’s mission to discover the equation that leads us through Parallel Worlds and the multiverse, to a meeting with God.

title: Ron Davis on The Gift of Dyslexia
body:
Ron Davis describes being born autistic and dyslexic, growing up in a time when there was little compassion for those who were different, and finally overcoming his challenges.

This is a story of someone who was unable to communicate until the age of 17. By 19, he was teaching calculus. At 36, he was a millionaire, but still ashamed that he couldn’t read. Davis shares his amazing breakthrough that enabled him to look at dyslexia as a gift.
teaser: Ron Davis describes being born autistic and dyslexic, growing up in a time when there was little compassion for those who were different, and finally overcoming his challenges.

title: Christine Arena on High Purpose Companies
body:
Christine Arena, author of Cause for Success, discuses how high purpose companies developed their win-win philosophies regarding profits, people and the environment, and how consumers can prompt industry to move in this direction.

Some high profile companies are entering a brave new world where doing business with a conscience wins. Interviewing the Chief Executives of some well-known companies, Christine Arena found that not all corporate types have their head in the sand when it comes to their impact on humanity.
teaser: Christine Arena, author of Cause for Success, discuses how high purpose companies developed their win-win philosophies regarding profits, people and the environment, and how consumers can prompt industry to move in this direction.

title: Peter Russell on Looking for Love
body:
Peter Russell, co-author of The Consciousness Revolution, discusses the roll of human consciousness and values in creating our current environmental and societal crisis, and why it may well be the younger generation that provides the needed paradigm shift to solve the problem.

Peter Russell’s background is in mathematics and theoretical physics, and unanswered questions in both these areas dropped him on to his path of enlightenment. This took him to India, where he studied meditation and eastern philosophy. Once he had time to synthesize all these aspects of life, he came to some profound conclusions: that we cannot continue on our current path of greed and environmental degradation and expect any kind of future of abundance and joy. We ust dig down to the roots of what true fulfillment is and begin living it, as we repair the damage we’ve done to our host, the earth.
teaser: Peter Russell, co-author of The Consciousness Revolution, discusses the roll of human consciousness and values in creating our current environmental and societal crisis, and why it may well be the younger generation that provides the needed paradigm shift to solve the problem.

title: Reinhold Ziegler on Solar, Wind and Renewable Energy
body:
Renewable energy expert Reinhold Ziegler discusses how tapping into the natural forces that surround us yields a cleaner, cheaper and freer future for us all.

Ziegler describes how, as a physics/engineering major in Berkeley, he participated in the creation of what came to be known as the Integral Urban House. Their restoration of a 100-year-old Victorian created a house that was completely self-reliant, powered by the sun and the wind, where rabbits, chickens, fish, honeybees, plants, microbes, and people interacted in a mini-ecosystem.

Reinhold Ziegler is the founder and CEO of Synergy International, which designs and manufactures renewable energy systems and environmental technologies.
teaser: Renewable energy expert Reinhold Ziegler discusses how tapping into the natural forces that surround us yields a cleaner, cheaper and freer future for us all.

title: Ron Davis on Autism and Dyslexia
body:
Ron Davis explains what it’s like inside the dyslexic and autistic mind and how a dyslexic can turn their trait off and on.

Davis also discusses why the educational system is not meeting the needs of today’s children, dyslexic or not.
teaser: Ron Davis explains what it’s like inside the dyslexic and autistic mind and how a dyslexic can turn their trait off and on.

title: Jerry E. Smith on HAARP and Weather Modification
body:
Jerry E. Smith, author of Haarp: The Ultimate Weapon of the Conspiracy,  discusses the darker possibilities of an exotic technology. The story he tells is based on an incredible maze of science, the military, and secrecy. Smith built his work upon the work of Dr. Nick Begich, who offered the first public research on Haarp in his book, Angels Don’t Play this Haarp: Advances in Tesla Technology.

HAARP, a radio antenna array in Alaska (and other locations), is said to enable certain government departments to “see around the horizon” by bouncing frequencies off the ionosphere. Although the government denies any military use, some question the funding of this project and its actual use. As the story continue to evolve, the questions about this little-known project loom large.
teaser: Jerry E. Smith, author of Haarp: The Ultimate Weapon of the Conspiracy,  discusses the darker possibilities of an exotic technology. The story he tells is based on an incredible maze of science, the military, and secrecy. What exactly is Haarp? Let’s see what Jerry has to say.

title: Bruce Lipton on the Biology of Belief
body:
Bruce Lipton’s work indicates that attitude and environment, seldom our genes, dictate the quality of our health. The agendas that control our state of health reside in the subconscious mind and Dr. Lipton says that a little re-programming can work wonders.

Bruce Lipton’s work in cellular biology has rendered many Ah-ha moments, as he has come to understand that our bodies and state of health are a direct reflection of the level of harmony within the vast community of cells of which we are made. A happy community of cells makes a happy body. 

What’s more, he has found that cells do not operate as described in textbooks. He says that we are not just biological machines, but that every cell in our being communicates not only with each other, but also with a vast field of intelligence.
teaser: Bruce Lipton’s work indicates that attitude and environment, seldom our genes, dictate the quality of our health. The agendas that control our state of health reside in the subconscious mind and Dr. Lipton says that a little re-programming can work wonders.

title: Dannion Brinkley on The Afterlife
body: If you are ready for a wild ride and a hoot to boot, you will love this close up interview with Dannion Brinkley. Whoever said lightning never strikes twice was wrong, dead wrong. The first time lightning struck Dannion he was essentially fried and laid dead for 28 minutes with a sheet over his face before returning from an incredible journey on the other side. The second time, which resulted in a near death experience, Dannion realized there was a story to tell. A story that will ensure anyone  hat who is facing transition, which will ultimately be all of us, will view  experience in a much more embracing and  loving way. For many, his story actually takes away the fear of dying.
teaser: After lying dead for 28 minutes on a hospital stretcher, Dannion Brinkley had to navigate his way back to his stiffening body to tell the tale of the incredible events he was just shown on the other side.

title: Rob Williams on Psych-K
body:
Rob Williams discusses how our subconscious beliefs affect our bodies, and why, as a psychotherapist, he developed Psych-K because he found traditional therapy lacking. The subconscious mind processes information 500,000 times faster than our conscious minds! Is it any wonder that it controls the show whether we know its agendas or not? Rob William’s remarkably effective Psych-K work helps us re-program the hidden beliefs that no longer serve us.

This is highly practical work and does not go into the reasons or the deeply emotional to have effect; it is akin to reprogramming a computer and is highly effective and instantaneous.
teaser: Rob Williams discusses how our subconscious beliefs affect our bodies, and why, as a psychotherapist, he developed Psych-K because he found traditional therapy lacking.

title: Gregg Braden on The God Code
body:
According to noted author and lecturer Gregg Braden, there is a code embedded in our cells that links us all, and this code can be the key to bridging the difficulties that separate us as individuals and cultures.

Gregg Braden possesses a rare combination of scientific acumen and a vast knowledge of spiritual texts. While researching his latest book, The God Code, he discovered that we are at a time in history where the easy lessons are past and the time has come to dig deep and learn the big lessons.

From his groundbreaking books, Awakening to Zero Point and Walking Between the Worlds, to his pioneering work in The Isaiah Effect, Braden offers meaningful solutions to the challenges of our time.
teaser: According to noted author and lecturer Gregg Braden, there is a code embedded in our cells that links us all, and this code can be the key to bridging the difficulties that separate us as individuals and cultures.

title: Scott Taylor on Dolphins and The Cetacean Nation
body:
Scott Taylor, author of Souls in the Sea and founder of the Cetacean Studies Institute, discusses dolphins and what is now known about these enlightened citizens of the sea.He was living a quiet life as a husband, father and furniture maker when he had a visit from a man with a turban on his head and brilliant sparkling eyes. The stranger gave Taylor a scroll containing a tale that completely changed the direction of his life.

Beneath the waters that cover 70 percent of the earth’s surface live beings that may be equal to humans and even surpass us in many ways. These Souls in the Sea  are dolphins and whales, and Scott Taylor’s life is passionately devoted to bridging the gap between them and us.
teaser: Scott Taylor, author of Souls in the Sea and founder of the Cetacean Studies Institute, discusses dolphins and what is now known about these enlightened citizens of the sea.

title: Gary Schwartz on The After Life
body:
Gary Schwartz has all the right credentials; he received his doctorate from Harvard, taught psychiatry and psychology at Yale, and is currently a professor of, get this, psychology, medicine, neurology, psychiatry, and surgery at the University of Arizona.  Fortunately for everyone who has ever wanted to communicate with a deceased loved one, Dr. Schwartz is drawing on all of his knowledge in the research of afterlife communications, in spite of the historic giggle factor by colleagues and the media.

In this in depth interview, Gary gives insight into the scientific research he has done to investigate the plausibility of psychic mediums. He then shares his experiences with media and skeptics. This information has helped many people, in many ways, as they are dealing with the loss of loved ones.
teaser: After 8 years of rigorous academic research,  Dr. Gary Schwartz says he believes life after life is real and love is the frequency that allows us to communicate between the two worlds.

title: Hazel Courteney on Investigations into the Afterlife
body:
Most of you watching this are aware that there is a quickening of events occurring here on Earth. In response to this, many people are having unexpected and surprising spiritual awakenings. One such person is Hazel Courteney, who has also been a part of Dr. Gary Schwartz’s afterlife experiments. She underwent a phenomenal process of awakening in which her ability to reach beyond the physical world went without notice.

Hazel writes about this incredible awakening in her book, Evidence for the Sixth Sense, which you should read in conjunction with Dr. Gary Schwartz’s work.
teaser: Hazel Courteney underwent a phenomenal process of awakening in which her ability to reach beyond the physical world went without notice. Join her as she explains her amazing experiences.

title: Nick Begich on The Dangers of Cell Phones
body:
Have you ever noticed that your ear or head feels different after talking on your cell phone? Dr. Nick Begich reveals the findings of studies the cell phone companies don’t want you to know about.

Begich provides tips on how to make your cell phone safer to use, and says that you should never allow children to use cell phones until their brain has fully developed.
teaser: Have you ever noticed that your ear or head feels different after talking on your cell phone? Dr. Nick Begich reveals the findings of studies the cell phone companies don’t want you to know about.

title: Nick Begich on Manchurian Candidates
body:
Nick Begich discusses how the human body is affected by coherent radio frequency (RF) signals.

Over a 40-year period, more than 500,000 Americans were victims of human experimentation. If one of them were you, how would you know? Learn how this technology could impact your life.
teaser: Nick Begich discusses how the human body is affected by coherent radio frequency (RF) signals.

title: Acharya S on the Christ Conspiracy
body:
Acharya S’s research and theories put the origins of the world’s religions, as we know them, under a new light. As an archeologist, historian and linguist who can speak read and interpret 10 languages, Acharya S has access to direct interpretation of many documents and ancient texts. 

In this interview she makes a solid case for the position that all religions stem from our connection with one eternal source.
teaser: In this interview Acharya S makes a solid case for the position that all religions stem from our connection with one eternal source.

title: Robin & Michael Mastro on The Way of Vastu
body:
Robin and Michael Mastro, co-authors of Altars of Power and Grace, discuss Vastu, the predecessor of feng shui.

Vastu is a 5,000- year-old tradition that has its roots in the science of magnetism and geometry. Everything from the direction your head faces when you sleep to clutter is taken into consideration when arranging a home or office according to Vastu.
teaser: Robin and Michael Mastro, co-authors of Altars of Power and Grace, discuss Vastu, the predecessor of feng shui.

title: Hank Wesselman on Shamans and the Big Kahuna
body:
Imagine lying in your bed and suddenly becoming paralyzed and transported 5,000 years into the future, where you’re experiencing life through the eyes and body of a stranger. This is what happened to anthropologist Hank Wesselman, a scientist who spent 25 years working in the fossil beds of East Africa’s Rift Valley alongside the Leake family. 

These visionary experiences put him on an entirely new path in his investigations into the evolution of human beings and our consciousness, both from the past and into the future.

The great Polynesian line of Kahunas call Hank Wesselman the “Vessel Man,” the one who carries knowledge.
teaser: Imagine lying in your bed and suddenly becoming paralyzed and transported 5,000 years into the future, where you’re experiencing life through the eyes and body of a stranger. This is what happened to anthropologist Hank Wesselman, author of Spiritwalker: Messages from the Future.

title: Eric Pearl on The Reconnection
body:
When one is called upon by unseen forces to be used as a conduit for healing, it’s wise to listen. Formerly a chiropractor in Los Angeles, Dr. Eric Pearl has listened and now shares his esoteric wisdom with the world in his work, The Reconnection.

Why are prominent doctors and medical researchers all over the world interested in the extraordinary healings reported by the patients of Eric Scott Pearl? What does it mean when these patients report the sudden disappearance of afflictions such as cancer, AIDS-related conditions, and cerebral palsy? And what does it mean when people who interact with Eric report a sudden ability to access this healing energy not just for themselves, but for others, too? What is this phenomenon?
teaser: Why are prominent doctors and medical researchers all over the world interested in the extraordinary healings reported by the patients of Eric Scott Pearl? Well, you might have to reconsider everything you’ve read up until now about conventional healing.

title: Vernon Woolf on Holodynamics
body:
Vernon Woolf discusses how he became involved with healing disease, overcoming mental illnesses, transforming drug abusers, eradicating crime, the meltdown of the Iron Curtain and terrorism. Not bad for a humble guy from Utah.

In his book, Woolf shows that Holodynamics alters the nature of what is possible in the human experience – and it’s about time.
teaser: Vernon Woolf discusses how he became involved with healing disease, overcoming mental illnesses, transforming drug abusers, eradicating crime, the meltdown of the Iron Curtain and terrorism. Not bad for a humble guy from Utah.

title: Teri Mahaney on Changing your Mind
body:
Teri Mahaney discusses reprogramming our actions while we sleep. 

Teri Mahaney has a PhD in higher education administration and leadership and has won Outstanding Woman of the Year. Dr. Mahaney presents workshops on brain states and their effect on performance, creativity, healing, consciousness, karma and transformation.
teaser: Teri Mahaney discusses reprogramming our actions while we sleep.

title: Graham Hancock on Ayahuasca
body:
Science journalist, Graham Hancock shares his exploration of expanded consciousness by means of the beverage Ayahuasca (the Vine of Souls).

Digging deep is the hallmark of science journalist, Graham Hancock, who has sold over five million books, featuring his scientific research into the mysteries of the ancient structures and texts, archaeoastronomy and beyond. Now, he delves into the ultimate and least understood mystery, that of the spirit world. His journey took him to Brazil, where he drank from the Ayahuasca cup with the elder shamans.
teaser: Science journalist, Graham Hancock shares his exploration of expanded consciousness by means of the beverage Ayahuasca (the Vine of Souls).

title: Stanislav Grof on Psychotropic Drugs
body:
Psychoanalyst Stanislav Grof discusses his work in expanded awareness, which began as a medical student volunteering for a new drug called LSD.

Dr. Grof began his career in psychotherapy at the end of the Nazi occupation of Czechoslovakia. In his work exploring altered states of consciousness, he came to see how ludicrous the traditional medical understanding of these non-ordinary states of consciousness was. For example, in today’s lexicon of pathology, Buddha would be labeled schizophrenic, or at least borderline and St. John of the Cross a heredity degenerative. 

Currently, Dr. Grof is Professor of Psychology at the California Institute of Integral Studies (CIIS) in the Department of Philosophy, Cosmology, and Consciousness, and teaches at the Pacifica Graduate Institute in Santa Barbara, CA.
teaser: Psychoanalyst Stanislav Grof discusses his work in expanded awareness, which began as a medical student volunteering for a new drug called LSD.

title: Stuart Hameroff on the Real What the Bleep
body:
Dr. Stuart Hameroff explains the on-board computers in our cells called microtubules, the little fields of pure potential that define and drive us. Hameroff addresses how it all works in the field of Quantum Physics and what we can take away from this knowledge. 

Anesthesiologist Stuart Hameroff is a physician and researcher at the University of Arizona Medical Center.
teaser: Dr. Stuart Hameroff explains the on-board computers in our cells called microtubules, the little fields of pure potential that define and drive us. Hameroff addresses how it all works in the field of Quantum Physics and what we can take away from this knowledge.

title: John Demartini on How to Make a Profit and Still Get to Heaven
body:
John Demartini, author of How to Make One Hell of a Profit and Still Get to Heaven, discusses the common conflict between spirituality and wealth. He explains that it doesn’t matter how much you make, it is your hierarchy of values that determines your financial destiny. His initial quest was to become a surfer, but Dr. John Demartini found his true calling teaching his understanding about the balance of spirituality and wealth.

This is a great interview with a man who has an obvious compassion and understanding of his fellow human being. You may have to alter your view of yourself after this, something that may come at just the right time. John’s message is especially important in a time where wisdom is becoming the highest value commodity and if you have the opportunity to see him in person, jump at the chance. To have wealth in spirit as well as money in the bank IS allowed!
teaser: John Demartini, author of How to Make One Hell of a Profit and Still Get to Heaven, discusses the common conflict between spirituality and wealth.

title: John Jay Harper on Trance-Formation
body: Mystic John Jay Harper, author of Tranceformers: Shamans of the 21st Century, discusses how discovering his deceased friend standing at the end of his bed at four o’clock in the morning changed his life. The image Harper saw was alive, vibrant and shimmering and yet it was solid. “And then I looked at his face and I saw him smile at me and we made eye contact and there was like a telepathic feeling—more than just thoughts—there was energy being transferred between us and I’ve never been the same since.”
teaser: Mystic John Jay Harper, author of Tranceformers: Shamans of the 21st Century, discusses how discovering his deceased friend standing at the end of his bed at four o’clock in the morning changed his life.

title: Shlomo Shoham on Peace for Future Generations
body:
Soft-spoken Shlomo Shoham discusses his spiritual path, from his appointment as the youngest judge in Israel’s history, to developing awareness, to becoming a meditation teacher and the first Commissioner for Future Generations.

The Commission for Future Generations oversees all legislation in the Israeli parliament to ensure the well being of the next seven generations.
teaser: Soft-spoken Shlomo Shoham discusses his spiritual path, from his appointment as the youngest judge in Israel’s history, to developing awareness, to becoming a meditation teacher and the first Commissioner for Future Generations.

title: Lorraine Day on Cancer and Faith
body:
When we are facing the statistics that 1 in 3 of every US citizen will develop cancer of some sort, you may want to turn to Dr. Lorraine Day for education, guidance and practical wisdom. Dr. Day is a living testament to creating health and healing through natural means.

When Dr. Lorraine Day was diagnosed with cancer she decided to heal herself without the aid of the medical community.  What makes this story even more interesting is that she, herself, is a highly respected orthopedic surgeon. After 30 years as an agnostic, she turned to belief and an ancient recipe for health from the Old Testament after she learned that the cancer had spread.
teaser: If you have someone in your family that has a medical condition and you don’t trust what you hear, you may want to pay very close attention to this interview with Dr. Lorraine Day as she explains how she healed her cancer, herself.

title: Hank Wesselman on Healing the Soul
body:
In this interview, Hank Wesselman discusses how the shaman of the world can heal people of virtually every disease known to man by including the step of healing the soul.

As an anthropologist working on some of the most prestigious archeological sites in the world, Hank entered a more hidden world over twenty years ago quite by accident, and as the years progressed he became a shaman and a healer.
teaser: In this interview, Hank Wesselman discusses how the shaman of the world can heal people of virtually every disease known to man by including the step of healing the soul.

title: Da Vid on The Light Party
body:
Da Vid discusses his early years and the formation of The Light Party.

Da Vid is a visionary, a medical doctor, an artist, and founder of a health-based political party (The Light Party). As director of the San Francisco medical research foundation, Da Vid turned to natural healing modalities as well as more subtle therapies, such as light and sound.
teaser: Da Vid discusses his early years and the formation of The Light Party.

title: Robert Greenwald on WalMart: The High Cost of Cheap Goods
body:
Filmmaker Robert Greenwald discusses the making of his film, Wal-Mart: The High Cost of Low Price.

Filmmaker Robert Greenwald is among those brave producers who dare to speak out.His documentaries outfoxed and uncovered the Iraq War and paved the way for his newest film, Wal-Mart: The High Cost of Low Price. Greenwald also shares the new process of film distribution that gets information out faster than traditional channels.
teaser: Filmmaker Robert Greenwald discusses the making of his film, Wal-Mart: The High Cost of Low Price.

title: Jacob Tietelbaum on Natural Cures
body:
Suffering from fibromyalgia from birth, Dr. Jacob Tietelbaum had to find his own way to becoming pain free when he realized in his days as an intern that his colleagues couldn’t help him. Today he’s an outspoken proponent of turning to natural substances as a first approach to living without pain. 

A point of hope in these changing times is the number of medical doctors coming to realize that drugs and surgery do not constitute wellness. One such doctor is Jacob Tietelbaum, author of the book Pain Free 1-2-3.
teaser: Suffering from fibromyalgia from birth, Dr. Jacob Tietelbaum had to find his own way to becoming pain free when he realized in his days as an intern that his colleagues couldn’t help him. Today he’s an outspoken proponent of turning to natural substances as a first approach to living without pain.

title: Aaron Russo on America: From Freedom to Fascism
body:
Aaron Russo, writer/filmmaker/director of the movie America: From Freedom to Fascism, discusses the history of the Federal Reserve system, the true agenda of those in power, and the legality of the IRS (Internal Revenue Service). He exposes how the federal government is not legally allowed to charge American citizens a federal income tax, and how our civil liberties are eroding under the guise of national security. Are these simple conspiracy theories or are government agencies working against us?
Born in Brooklyn and raised on Long Island, Aaron Russo began promoting rock and roll shows at local theaters while still in high school. From there, he worked in his family’s business and opened a night club in Chicago where he helped create the careers of such legendary acts as Led Zeppelin, The Who, Janis Joplin, The Grateful Dead and Jefferson Airplane. Aaron managed Bette Midler and was the first Hollywood Producer to command $1 million for his services, with titles such as Trading Places and The Rose.
This interview was filmed in the summer of 2006, Aaron Russo died of bladder cancer on August 24th 2007.
teaser: Aaron Russo, writer/producer/director of the movie America: From Freedom to Fascism, discusses the history of the Federal Reserve, the true agenda of those in power, and the legality of the IRS.

title: Robert Tennyson Stevens on The Language of Life
body:
Studying the language of the Hopi Indians, Robert Tennyson Stevens discovered that they had no word for now, because the Hopi live in the now. In this interview he describes how language shapes thought, which shapes reality.

Stevens’ experience with the Hopi language sparked a lifelong fascination with the spoken word and how it affects the human ability to manifest life. There are keys to life in language that are subtle yet powerful, and Robert lets us in on what they are.
teaser: Studying the language of the Hopi Indians, Robert Tennyson Stevens discovered that they had no word for now, because the Hopi live in the now. In this interview he describes how language shapes thought, which shapes reality.

title: Robin Mastro on Altars of Power and Grace
body:
Robin Mastro, author of Altars of Power and Grace, discusses practical ways of creating a harmonious space for work, whether at home or in the office.

Vastu is a 5,000- year-old tradition that has its roots in the science of magnetism and geometry. Everything from the direction your head faces when you sleep to clutter is taken into consideration when arranging a home or office according to Vastu.
teaser: Robin Mastro, author of Altars of Power and Grace, discusses practical ways of creating a harmonious space for work, whether at home or in the office.

title: Michael Gelb on Thinking Like Da Vinci
body:
Unless you have been asleep at the wheel for the last couple of years, you will know that there is a worldwide phenomenon called ‘The DaVinci Code’. Michael Gelb is internationally recognized as a pioneer in the fields of creative thinking, accelerated learning, and innovative leadership, leading seminars for organizations such as BP, Nike, Merck, IBM, Microsoft, DuPont, and KPMG.

In this interview, Michael tells you how you can approach life and the future from the many different angles that the master used in his own work, allowing you to ‘Think Like DaVinci’ and ‘Work Like DaVinci’, both titles of his hot selling books.

Check out all Michael’s books and become the genius that you are!
teaser: In this interview, Michael tells you how you can approach life and the future from the many different angles that the master used in his own work, allowing you to ‘Think Like DaVinci’ and ‘Work Like DaVinci’, both titles of his hot selling books.

title: Hollis Polk on Looking into our Financial Future
body:
Psychic Hollis Polk takes an intuitive look at our economic future.

Hollis Polk, is a trained hypnotherapist, NLP practitioner (neuro-linguistic programming), healer and intuitive. Educated at Harvard, Hollis believes that this world would be a better place if every person saw situations and the people around them clearly, using their intuition as a guide. To that end, she has developed a psychic training program that develops our innate abilities to understand the world through our clear-senses (clairsentience).
teaser: Psychic Hollis Polk takes an intuitive look at our economic future.

title: Scott Tips on Drugs, the FDA and Regulations
body:
Is there a reason why governments feel they have the right to govern every aspect of our existence, as if we know nothing about ourselves? Surely, we hold sovereignty over our physical bodies, so how can we protect ourselves in current times? Scott Tips who is the editor of Health Freedom News and the president and legal counsel for the National Health Federation, has made it his life’s mission to make sure we hold onto those rights.

This is no small matter, as the potential for the FDA to rule what can and can’t be classified as a drug now looks like it will include common health supplements like vitamins and minerals. Where will they stop?
teaser: In this interview, Scott Tips, a Food and Drug lawyer for over 20 years, discusses the FDA’s current and potential future power regarding supplements.

title: Margaret Starbird on Mary Magdelene
body: Margaret Starbird was a devout Catholic, a mother of five and a military wife when she stumbled on some literature that both frightened her and forced her to begin researching what she later referred to as “the lost story of Mary Magdelene.” Aided by her academic background with a Master’s degree in Comparative Literature and the support of her priest and bible study group, Margaret ultimately came to understand that the demotion of one of the Bible’s most influential women to the status of prostitute was both unforgivable and heretical. Furthermore, she says that misrepresentation of Mary was intentional on the part of those who revised the Bible. So convincing was her work, in fact, that Dan Brown based much of his research into Mary Magdelene’s life in the Da Vinci Code on Margaret’s work. This modest and truth-driven woman captured our minds and hearts.
teaser: Margaret Starbird was a devout Catholic, a mother of five and a military wife when she stumbled on some literature that both frightened her and forced her to begin researching what she later referred to as “the lost story of Mary Magdelene.”

title: Stephen Bassett on The UFO and ET Cover Up
body:
Stephen Basset discusses how the free flow of information regarding extra terrestrial presence has been forbidden in the media. Basset calls on every citizen to demand the proof of extra terrestrial life that we intuitively already know exists.

Stephen Bassett, is a lobbyist, activist, commentator and columnist. He is the founder of the Paradigm Research Group and the Executive Director of the political action committee, X-PPAC. His work has been referenced in, among others, the Washington Post, Washington Times, New York Times, Legal Times, Christian Science Monitor, National Journal and O’Dweyer’s Washington Report, and he has been featured in documentaries and a guest on numerous radio programs
teaser: Stephen Basset discusses how the free flow of information regarding extra terrestrial presence has been forbidden in the media. Basset calls on every citizen to demand the proof of extra terrestrial life that we intuitively already know exists.

title: Martin Gray on Sacred Sites
body:
Martin Gray is an anthropologist and photographer specializing in the study of sacred sites and pilgrimage traditions around the world. Traveling as a pilgrim, Martin has spent more than twenty years visiting and photographing over 1,000 sacred sites in 120 countries. In this interview he talks about his background and education, and his passionate desire to introduce sacred sites to a wider global audience.

The son of world traveling parents, keenly interested in art and archaeology, Martin spent several of his youthful years living in foreign destinations such as Germany and India. In his early twenties, he returned to Asia and began a decades-long study of the mythology and archaeology of Hinduism and Buddhism. Later, combining his scholarly studies, photographic skill and spiritual yearning, he set out to travel the world as a traditional pilgrim. Martin’s photographs have been used by National Geographic, UNESCO, WWF, and are featured in hundreds of magazines, books and web sites around the world.
teaser: Traveling as a pilgrim, Martin spent twenty years visiting and photographing over 1000 sacred sites in eighty countries. Martin Gray talks about his background, education and passion behind his desire to bring these Sacred Sites to the public.

title: Ashok Gangadean on the Philosophy of our Global Vision
body:
Regina Meredith and professor Ashok Gangadean discuss The World Wisdom Council, and viewing the world through different lenses.

Professor Ashok Gangadean has developed deep dialog, a method of communication that helps individuals and world governments see through the lens of a stranger with differing views, to identify common desires and create genuine communication and compassion.

Professor of Philosophy at Haverford College, Founder-Director of the Global Dialogue Institute, host of an Emmy-nominated television show, Ashok Gangadean has published several books on global reason, global philosophy, and dialogue and is co-convener of the World Commission on Global Consciousness & Spirituality, which brings eminent world leaders together in sustained deep dialogue to cultivate global vision and wisdom for the new millennium.
teaser: Regina Meredith and professor Ashok Gangadean discuss The World Wisdom Council, and viewing the world through different lenses.

title: Burton Goldberg on Alternative Medicine (Part 1)
body:
Before you begin watching this interview, you would be wise to pick up a paper and pencil. Burton Goldberg is going to be mentioning some names and websites that you are going to find useful in your search for alternative medicine. Burton was the founder and publisher of Alternative Medicine magazine, which has since changed hands. He is also the author of one of the most comprehensive tomes on alternative therapies in the world, Alternative Medicine: The Definitive Guide. Subjects covered include, the truth about mad cow disease and Alzheimer’s in the United States, how non-holistic dental work is affecting your overall health, and startling news regarding cancer.
 
Burton Goldberg is on a mission to reform conventional medicine and to help people reclaim their health. He is a dynamo, traveling, speaking, and teaching all over the country three weeks out of every month and in this interview gives it his all with all guns blazing.
teaser: Burton Goldberg talks about his book, Alternative Medicine, as well as the truth about mad cow disease and Alzheimer’s in the United States, how non-holistic dental work is affecting your overall health, and startling news regarding cancer.

title: Russell Targ on the End of Suffering
body:
Educated as a laser physicist, Russell’s life took an interesting turn when he began working at the Stanford Research Institute training remote viewing to CIA spies. He was the man who trained CIA spies to remote view into the military secrets, events and strategies of the former Soviet Union, China and other countries which included viewing into the future. When all of the high intrigue had passed, however, he discovered that what mattered most was what he developed deep within himself from all those years sitting in the dark with spies in training, that of the journey inward to our true nature.

Today, Targ devotes his time to ESP research and workshops on remote viewing and spiritual healing.
teaser: Educated as a laser physicist, Russell’s life took an interesting turn when he began working at the Stanford Research Institute training remote viewing to CIA spies. Russell shares his experiences and what he learned from all those years of sitting in the dark.

title: Lee Gerdes on Brain State Technologies
body:
This man’s work may be one of the most important contributions to healing mankind, to date. Lee Gerdes has degrees in physics, mathematics, theology and psychology, and happily confesses to being a geek! After designing marketing algorithms for major online retailers, Lee began looking for a way to switch between the right and left brains more easily.

Now, he has combined everything he has learned in his lifetime to create a technology that borrows from the healing power of Neuro-feedback and overlays it with computer software that, in effect, evolves our brain by creating more neural connections. The results are astounding! Join in to learn the amazing ways the brain works and how it can actually heal itself.
teaser: Lee Gerdes has degrees in physics, mathematics, theology and psychology and happily confesses to being a geek! Now, he has combined everything he has learned in his lifetime to create a technology that, in effect, evolves our brain by creating more neural connections.

title: Jean Shinoda Bolen on Women of Wisdom
body:
Jean Shinoda Bolen is telling the world that it’s time for the women to gather, in an effort to begin genuine global peace dialog. She asserts that with women at the table healing and healthy compromise are possible, in part because the female brain is wired more for diplomacy and moving between creative and logical processes, which is required in finding solutions. 

As a professor of psychiatry at the University of San Francisco, Bolen’s career as a feminine cultural leader has inspired many women to begin gathering in circles around the world, and to make their presence known in political arenas and board rooms, to create a more compassionate and mature species through conscious parenting. Featured at the end of this video is Deborah Koppel Mitchell, creator of Spheres Women’s Circles, which has started to gather women in answer to Bolen’s call. This interview was made possible by kind permission of The Message Company at The International Conference on Science & Consciousness.
teaser: Jean Shinoda Bolen explores the psychological, spiritual, and scientific aspects of women as collaborators for change.
cast: Jean Shinoda Bolen, Deborah Koppel Mitchell

title: Jonathan Goldman on Healing Sounds
body:
Sound offers perhaps some of the greatest potential in the field of health and healing. Sound was said to have been used in the ancient healing chambers of Egypt and has been proven to improve mental acuity and help relieve depression and much more in clinical studies. The man who has been at the center of this emerging art and science for the past 25 years is Jonathan Goldman who affirms that we all carry this instrument of healing inside us.

Jonathan is a writer, musician and teacher as well as an authority on sound healing and a pioneer in the field of harmonics.  He has studied with masters of sound from both the scientific and spiritual traditions, including the Dalai Lama’s Chanting Gyuto and Gyume Monks and has been empowered by the Chant Master of the Drepung Loseling Monastery to teach Tibetan Overtone Chanting.
teaser: Jonathan Goldman is a writer, musician and teacher as well as an authority on sound healing and a pioneer in the field of harmonics. Wait until the end of the interview for an amazing example of healing sound when Jonathan gives us an impromptu performance!

title: Peter Russell on The Art of Letting Go
body:
Eco-philosopher Peter Russell discusses why attachment to the material world is at the root of most of our suffering.

Russel says that part of the problem is that the media constantly tells us what we lack, creating a false sense of need, and he describes how to unplug from what is not real and anchor into what is.
teaser: Eco-philosopher Peter Russell discusses why attachment to the material world is at the root of most of our suffering.

title: Walter Cruttenden on the Precession of the Equinox
body:
Walter Cruttenden, Director of the Binary Research Institute, discusses the precession of the equinox, binary stars, and the rise and fall of civilizations.

Ancient texts told our ancestors that the Sun had a companion in the heavens and that we were somehow bound to this other star. Walter has devoted himself completely to learning the truth of whether or not our star has a companion it’s gravitationally bound to in an amazing celestial dance that is shaking the world of astrophysics upside-down.

The precession of the equinox is the time it takes the equinox to traverse through all twelve constellations of the zodiac.
teaser: Walter Cruttenden, Director of the Binary Research Institute, discusses the precession of the equinox, binary stars, and the rise and fall of civilizations.

title: Walter Cruttenden on Sirius, the Binary Star
body:
Walter Cruttenden, Director of the Binary Research Institute, producer of The Great Year, and author of The Lost Star,  discusses the whether our sun is part of a binary system, and who its companion may be.

Sometimes called the Dog Star, the Hound, the Fox and even the Wolf, Sirius has been the subject of folklore for thousands of years across many cultures. It is speculated that in Egyptian times, the shaft from the Queen’s chamber always points to Sirius.
teaser: Walter Cruttenden, Director of the Binary Research Institute, producer of The Great Year, and author of The Lost Star,  discusses whether our sun is part of a binary system, and who its companion may be.

title: Paula Petrovic on Sand Play for the Soul
body:
Sand Play sounds rather childish until you realize what is actually happening on the soul level and how it can unlock lifelong problems. Paula Petrovic has taken on this therapy with gusto and has written her own book on the subject, called Sand Play for the Soul.

In this interview, Paula explains how Sand Play can affect anyone from any walk of life as it is reminiscent of our youthful play on the beach. It takes you back to a time where the soul was easily and creatively expressed through sand.

Try a session – you will be pleased and surprised by how inspiring it is.
teaser: You will be pleased and surprised by how inspiring sand play is after this interview with Paula Petrovic.

title: James Hutton on Facts of Life
body:
An outspoken commentator on the state of the health industry, Dr. James Hutton discusses little-known therapies such as Ultra-Violet, Ozone and Hydrogen Peroxide, and comments on Vaccines, Bird Flu, Hepatitis C and other deadly diseases.

Medical doctor and naturopath, Dr. Hutton has an insatiable appetite for cutting-edge healing techniques, as well as the truth behind his profession.
teaser: An outspoken commentator on the state of the health industry, Dr. James Hutton discusses little-known therapies such as Ultra-Violet, Ozone and Hydrogen Peroxide, and comments on Vaccines, Bird Flu, Hepatitis C and other deadly diseases.

title: Jeff Meiring on Miracles and Suicide
body:
Jeff Meiring was severely depressed after the death of his adopted son. In this interview Meiring shares the events that lead up to his decision to take his life, his plan to leave the pain behind, and the miraculous accidents that changed his mind. 

You see him here less than a month after the day he was due to take his life and he tells the story with candor, grace and a tangible inner peace.
teaser: Jeff Meiring was severely depressed after the death of his adopted son. In this interview Meiring shares the events that lead up to his decision to take his life, his plan to leave the pain behind, and the miraculous accidents that changed his mind.

title: Jim Hamilton on When Visionaries Thrive
body: Who are visionaries? They are the people who make bold decisions, even in the worst of times. Jim Hamilton, author of Visionaries Thrive in All Times, claims that each of us has the innate tools to become a visionary, which he says is going to become the difference between following others’ agendas and creating our own.
teaser: Who are visionaries? They are the people who make bold decisions, even in the worst of times. Author Jim Hamilton claims that each of us has the innate tools to become a visionary, which he says will become the difference between following others’ agendas and creating our own.

title: Fern Stewart Welch on The Heart Knows the Way
body:
Digging down into the deepest part of her being to connect to the sublime part that knows all, helped Fern Stewart to learn about what her beloved husband was experiencing as his mind and body was slipping away. What she learned will benefit each and every one of us that faces a loved one’s decline.

Her current book, The Heart Knows the Way, is a remarkably intimate and revealing account by the author of how she sought a better, more loving and enlightened approach to helping her husband through his lengthy decline and death. In the process she opened to a personal relationship with God, gained new insight into one of life’s most feared experiences, and completed the experience free of sadness and guilt, with renewed joy, meaning, purpose and reaffirmation of life.
teaser: Fern Stewart Welch shares what she learned as she connected with her deepest being in order to understand what her beloved husband experienced as his mind and body slipped away.

title: Becky Natrajan on Gastro-Intestinal Health
body:
As a gastroenterologist, Dr. Becky Natrajan saw patients’ health deteriorate in spite of her efforts as an MD. When a particularly frustrating patient returned after a year’s absence looking slim, vibrant and young, Dr. Natrajan decided to learn what was really needed to heal her patients.

Dr. Becky Natrajan is the author of If's, And's, or Butts & Guts, a guide to optimal health through nutrition that explains how to support internal health through the liver and digestive system.
teaser: As a gastroenterologist, Dr. Becky Natrajan saw patients’ health deteriorate in spite of her efforts as an MD. When a particularly frustrating patient returned after a year’s absence looking slim, vibrant and young, Dr. Natrajan decided to learn what was really needed to heal her patients.

title: Robert Greenwald on Iraq for Sale
body:
Film producer Robert Greenwald discusses war profiteering, and the making of the film, Iraq for Sale.

Regina caught up with Greenwald in his LA offices and talked about his reasons for making this film, the timing with the 2006 elections and the shocking amount of money that contractors are duping out of the American people through uncontested government deals.
teaser: Film producer Robert Greenwald discusses war profiteering, and the making of the film, Iraq for Sale.

title: Steven Ross on Beauty and LEFL
body:
In this lively and thought provoking interview that takes us back to the Greeks, to the forming of special rooms dedicated to the highest and best in the beauty of the day, to philosophers and musicians who channeled the feminine essence into artistic creation, Steven Ross discusses beauty, the feminine divine and his unique barometer on the state of a human being.

Steven Ross is the founder of the World Research Foundation, the purpose of which is to locate, gather, codify, evaluate, classify, and disseminate information dealing with health and the environment. Not only has Ross dedicated his life to gathering every known therapy and healing modality for public access, he has an intrinsic knowledge and appreciation of beauty.
teaser: Steven Ross discusses beauty, the feminine divine and his unique barometer on the state of a human being.

title: Michael Hane on Atlas Profilax
body:
What if there was a key, in each human being that could turn on, or off, our physical, mental or even spiritual wellbeing? There is a growing group of people that say this exists. It is the Atlas bone, the cradle that holds our heads above our spine. For a variety reasons, this bone is out of place, pinching off our life force to one degree or another in the vast majority of the population. It can have severe implications on the quality of our lives. 

Michael Hane is one of only a few practitioners in the USA who is able to ‘install’ the Atlas in a one-time procedure that is non-medicinal and requires no diagnosis. It is called the ATLASPROFILAX® method and may only be practiced safely by a specialist who has been educated and certified at the ATLASPROFILAX® Academy Switzerland SA in Sierre/Siders, Valais (Switzerland).
teaser: Michael Hane discusses the ATLASPROFILAX method of relocating the first cervical vertebra to its natural position and the profound effect it has on physical, mental and spiritual well being.

title: Byron Katie on The Work
body:
Byron Katie discusses self-inquiry – are our thoughts and feelings true, or just a program that we keep running, to our own detriment?

Severely depressed in her 30s Katie realized that when she believed that something should be different than it was (“My husband should love me more,” “My children should appreciate me”) she suffered, and that when she didn’t believe these thoughts, she felt peace. She realized that what had been causing her depression was not the world around her, but the beliefs she had about the world around her.

She saw that her attempt to find happiness was backward — instead of hopelessly trying to change the world to match her thoughts about how it should be, she questioned the thoughts. By meeting reality as it was, she experienced freedom and joy. Katie developed a simple yet powerful method of inquiry, called The Work, to helped make this transformation practical.
teaser: Byron Katie discusses self-inquiry – are our thoughts and feelings true, or just a program that we keep running, to our own detriment?

title: John Anthony West on Early Egyptian Civilizations
body: Author, lecturer and guide, John Anthony West, discusses the evidence that suggests the Sphinx may have been built much earlier than previously thought. In the early 1990s, West and Boston University geologist Robert Schoch revealed that the Great Sphinx of Giza, Egypt, showed evidence of rainfall erosion. Such erosion means that the Sphinx was carved during or before the rains that marked the transition of northern Africa from the last ice age to the present interglacial epoch. This transition occurred in the millennia from 10,000 to 5000 BC.
teaser: Author, lecturer and guide, John Anthony West, discusses the evidence that suggests the Sphinx may have been built much earlier than previously thought.

title: Robert Scaer on Dealing with Trauma
body:
Neurologist Dr. Robert Scaer author of The Trauma Spectrum: Hidden Wounds and Human Resiliency, discusses his book and the implications of childbirth and trauma.

Dr. Scaer explains that it is not necessarily large dramas that shape our life experience, but little, everyday traumas that impact all facets of our daily lives and inner experience. He says these everyday negative experiences mold our personalities, choices of partners, appetites and much more.
teaser: Neurologist Dr. Robert Scaer author of The Trauma Spectrum: Hidden Wounds and Human Resiliency, discusses his book and the implications of childbirth and trauma.

title: Claude Swanson on The Synchronized Universe
body:
Physicist Claude Swanson discusses the need for humanity to reconnect spirituality with actions.

Claude Swanson didn’t find what he was looking for as he worked his way through his education in physics, there were simply too many questions regarding energy dynamics, paranormal experience, and more that could not be addressed through the standard scientific model. He began looking at ancient cycles of consciousness and the science of remote viewing to prove that we can bridge the worlds of science and spirituality. Swanson says that some of what we now call the sciences was once called magic.

For the last fifteen years, interspersed with his conventional professional career in applied physics, Dr. Swanson has pursued investigations into unconventional physics. His principal interest has been unified field theory, the so-called Theory of Everything that could explain the universe at the deepest level, which has led him to investigate many aspects of the paranormal.
teaser: Physicist Claude Swanson discusses the need for humanity to reconnect spirituality with actions.

title: David Berceli on Releasing Post Traumatic Stress
body:
David Berceli discusses how the body naturally discharges trauma and how we suppress this natural process due to societal pressures and cultural shame.

Berceli is an international expert in the areas of trauma intervention and conflict resolution, the founder and CEO of Trauma Recovery Assessment & Prevention Services (TRAPS), and the creator of of Trauma Releasing Exercises (TRE) that release the deep chronic tension created in the body during a traumatic experience.
teaser: David Berceli discusses how the body naturally discharges trauma and how we suppress this natural process due to societal pressures and cultural shame.

title: Ralph Ellis on the Origins of the Bible (Part 1)
body:
In this first of a two-part interview, historian Ralph Ellis discusses why the Judaic culture may have stemmed from the Hyksos line of Egyptian Pharaohs.

Ralph Ellis explains why etymology is so important to the study of the origins of Biblical stories. Ralph has some highly interesting points of view and if you stay open to the information and connect the dots, you may find that you view the whole lineage of our biblical past completely differently.
teaser: In this first of a two-part interview, historian Ralph Ellis discusses why the Judaic culture may have stemmed from the Hyksos line of Egyptian Pharaohs.

title: Richard Hoagland on Proof of Life on Mars
body:
Richard Hoagland suggests that much of what we know as the U.S.-Soviet accomplishments in space are simply a camouflage for much deeper and profound truths, truths that we need to take a look at today to avoid a potentially similar fate as those civilizations that he says have disappeared.

Hoagland is a former museum space science Curator, a former NASA Consultant and, during the historic Apollo Missions to the Moon, was science advisor to Walter Cronkite and CBS News. In the mid-1960′s, at the age of 19 (possibly the youngest museum curator in the country at the time), Hoagland created his first elaborate commemorative event — around NASA’s first historic unmanned fly-by of the planet Mars, Mariner 4. A simultaneous all-night, transcontinental radio program the evening of the Encounter (linking the museum in Springfield, Mass., and NASA’s JPL control center, in Pasadena, CA), co-produced by Hoagland and WTIC-Radio, in Hartford, CT, that was subsequently nominated for a Peabody Award.
teaser: Richard Hoagland suggests that much of what we know as the U.S.-Soviet accomplishments in space are simply a camouflage for much deeper and profound truths, truths that we need to take a look at today to avoid a potentially similar fate as those civilizations that he says have disappeared.

title: Ian Wagge about Our Technological Future
body:
The gap between those who are technologically proficient and those who aren’t will never be more apparent than they are now. What does our technological future hold for us? Regina speaks with Ian Wagge, a Futurist who assists corporations in assessing the types of changes they need to prepare for to keep pace with the rapid changes in technology.

From retail industries to how we interface with our automobiles, Ian has a fascinating take on what our futures may look like.
teaser: What does our technological future look like? Regina speaks with Ian Wagge, a Futurist who assists corporations in assessing the changes they need to prepare for to keep pace with the ever changing and ever more competitive market.

title: Ralph Ellis on Egypt, the Bible and the Israelites (Part 2)
body:
In the second part of Regina Meredith’s interview with Ralph Ellis, they explore the origins of Jesus and discuss his possible lineage.

Where was Jesus from and why did the Magi visit him at his birth? Was he in fact born while in exile, of high order, becoming commander of a large group of soldiers?

Regardless of what you believe, Ellis has some points that are hard to ignore.
teaser: In the second part of Regina Meredith’s interview with Ralph Ellis, they explore the origins of Jesus and discuss his possible lineage.

title: Robert Schoch about the Sphinx
body:
Geologist Dr. Robert Schoch delves into the subject of ancient sites and how he believes these sites were used. He explains why he feels that sacred sites were chosen because of their mystical properties, and then enhanced by the ancients with sacred architecture.

Dr. Shoch, known for his research on the Great Sphinx and for his studies of the underwater structure off the coast of Yonaguni Island, Japan, is a tenured faculty member at Boston
teaser: Geologist Dr. Robert Schoch delves into the subject of ancient sites and how he believes these sites were used. He explains why he feels that sacred sites were chosen because of their mystical properties, and then enhanced by the ancients with sacred architecture.

title: Glenda Green on Sacred Touch Essential Oils
body:
Glenda Green is an author, and artist and an alchemist. Her passion is the essence of the plant kingdom, sacred essential oils. Glenda explains that the frequencies of essential oils can affect the body, the mind and the spirit beyond mental concepts, and can create bridges of consciousness between others and us.

Author of Love Without End and the Keys of Jeshua, Glenda Green is also acknowledged as one of the world’s foremost portrait painters and spiritual artists, and she is considered one of America’s finest realist oil painters. Her paintings are housed in major collections throughout the United States.
teaser: Author, artist and alchemist Glenda Green explains that the frequencies of essential oils can affect the body, the mind and the spirit, and can create bridges of consciousness between others and us.

title: Hale Dwoskin on the Sedona Method
body:
In 1976, Hale Dwoskin met Lester Levenson who, in 1952, had been told by doctors that he had only a few weeks to live. Lester discovered that by releasing his non-love feelings his health improved, and that after 3 months he attained both renewed health and peace of mind, both of which lasted 42 years beyond his doctors’ expectations. From this state of mind and his work with people for 22-years, Levenson inspired the creation (in 1974) of what is now known as the Sedona Method.

Dwoskin immersed himself in the releasing process and developed a close relationship with Lester that lasted until Levenson’s death in 1994. Several years before his death, Lester transferred his copyrights to Hale and asked that he continue his work. Sedona Training Associates is the main vehicle for sharing Lester’s teachings with the world, and Hale has added over 28 years of experience and knowledge to the work.
teaser: The Sedona Method, which has been validated by Harvard Medical School, enables you to release limiting thoughts and feelings that may have plagued you for years – even the first time you use the program – by addressing and releasing the thoughts and feelings at the root of a problem rather than treating symptoms.

title: Alex Grey on The Art of Humanity
body:
Alex Grey discusses his inspiration, his view on the future, the role of musicians as shamans and his relationship with his wife, artist Allyson Rymland Grey.

Alex Grey is an extraordinary artist, bringing all the magic, majesty and mystery of human existence into vivid images that awe and inspire.
teaser: Alex Grey discusses his inspiration, his view on the future, the role of musicians as shamans and his relationship with his wife, artist Allyson Rymland Grey.

title: George Green on The Big Picture (Part 2)
body: George Green discusses what he calls the Big Picture, and it is big. From ancient Atlantean documents held by the Tibetan Monks to Nuclear Energy and the future of our species, George holds nothing back in this fascinating but spine chilling interview. He also reveals the chilling details of the atomic bombs of World War 2, reverse engineered UFO technology from the 50′s and the Tibetan monks who held the records of Atlantean times.
teaser: George Green discusses what he calls the Big Picture, and it is big. From ancient Atlantean documents held by the Tibetan Monks to Nuclear Energy and the future of our species, George holds nothing back in this fascinating but spine chilling interview.

title: Marilyn Nyborg on Gathering the Women
body:
Numerous women have contacted Marilyn Nyborg describing the same vision: that we needed to begin to gather the women of the world. Though these women came from diverse backgrounds, they all shared a deep passion for awakening the power of women in service of a better world. As one solution in the global movement toward balance, Marilyn Nyborg, and a handful of other women, created a platform for change called, Gather the Women.

Marilyn Says this group, which is gathering steam around the world, does not fit the profile of any other women’s organizations, in that they do not have an agenda. They simply gather together, uplift and encourage one another, and allow the women’s strength to begin showing in the outside world in its own unique way. Marilyn says it’s time for the story of women’s value to change which can be difficult in an unconscious world that equates being feminine with weakness.
teaser: One solution in the global movement toward balance, Marilyn Nyborg, and a handful of other women, created a platform for change called, Gather the Women.

title: Jill Kuykendall on Soul Retrieval
body:
Have you ever suffered a serious accident, emotional trauma or loss from which feel you never fully recovered from the sense of having lost a part of yourself? Jill Kuykendall’s life’s work is helping people recover those lost parts with an ancient practice called soul retrieval.

Among indigenous people, it is generally understood that traumatic life experiences can fragment our inner, vital essence (soul) resulting in the loss or disassociation of soul parts that leave, carrying the burden of pain, shock, extreme emotion or memory of a trauma that are unbearable to the sufferer at the time. This fragmentation can occur in response to an obvious life trauma (post-traumatic stress syndrome experienced by military veterans is a classic example), or from a subtle troubling experience so personal to an individual that no one else would know that a trauma had occurred.
teaser: Have you ever suffered a serious accident, emotional trauma or loss from which feel you never fully recovered from the sense of having lost a part of yourself? Jill Kuykendall’s life’s work is helping people recover those lost parts with an ancient practice called soul retrieval.

title: Harvey Bigelsen on Holographic Blood
body:
Author of Blood Mysteries: Myth, Magic or Reality, Dr. Harvey Bigelsen explains the building blocks of a healthy immune system. Dr. Bigelsen’s work in the field of holistic and biological medicine healing led to his awe-inspiring work in decoding holographic images in human blood. These electromagnetic pictures foretell the condition of our health and events that have yet to occur.

Dr. Bigelsen is the first medical doctor to practice isopathy (biological medicine) in North America. As the first president of the Arizona Homeopathic Medical Board, Dr. Bigelsen drafted guidelines and standards for the practice of Holistic Medicine in Arizona that set the precedent in the United States.
teaser: Author of Blood Mysteries: Myth, Magic or Reality, Dr. Harvey Bigelsen explains the building blocks of a healthy immune system. Dr. Bigelsen’s work in the field of holistic and biological medicine healing led to his awe-inspiring work in decoding holographic images in human blood.

title: Phillip Mountrose on Emotional Freedom Technique
body:
Phillip Mountrose discusses Emotional Freedom Technique (EFT), an acupressure technique combined with affirmations, which has provided many with relief from pain, diseases and emotional issues.

EFT has been called an emotional version of acupuncture – without the needles. It is a technique of stimulating energy meridian points on the body by tapping on them with the fingertips.

Dr. Phillip Mountrose is the Educational Director of Awakenings Institute and its lead instructor at both the Sacramento and Central California Coast Schools. He is an internationally known teacher, author, speaker, Holistic Hypnotherapist, NLP Practitioner, Reiki Master, EFT Practitioner and Spiritual Intuitive serving others as a Minister of Holistic Healing.
teaser: Phillip Mountrose discusses Emotional Freedom Technique (EFT), an acupressure technique combined with affirmations, which has provided many with relief from pain, diseases and emotional issues.

title: Leslie Feinberg on Neuro Modulation Technique
body:
Leslie Feinberg’s NMT, Neuromodulation Technique, is one of the most elegant and efficient pathways to healing developed to date. Working with consciousness at the quantum level, NMT helps create clear communication between the cells of the body. By reinstituting proper communication between the cells, the natural healing systems of the body can progress without impediment.

NMT is directed at re-establishing the body’s innate capacity to heal. When illness happens, it is often a result of factors that confuse the body’s internal control center, the Autonomic Control System (ACS), making it impossible to regulate the body to a healthy state. Using NMT protocols, the practitioner works with the quantum healing forces of the body to gain cooperation from the areas of the body, mind and soul that have fallen out of communication.
teaser: Leslie Feinberg’s NMT, Neuromodulation Technique, is one of the most elegant and efficient pathways to healing developed to date. The practitioner works with the quantum healing forces of the body to gain cooperation from the areas of the body, mind and soul that have fallen out of communication.

title: Belleruth Naparstek on Visualization and Guided Imagery
body:
Psychotherapist, author and guided imagery innovator Belleruth Naparstek discusses the difference between visualization and guided imagery.

Belleruth Naparstek created the Time Warner Health Journeys guided imagery audio series and has authored many books on guided imagery, intuition and healing.
teaser: Psychotherapist, author and guided imagery innovator Belleruth Naparstek discusses the difference between visualization and guided imagery.

title: Tom Bender on Sacred Space and Sustainable Architecture
body:
Architect Tom Bender discusses using space in a sacred way, and paying attention to chi (life force), which permeates everything.

Bender shares his experience with a friend’s precognitive dream that shifted his severely rational mindset to a more right-brained mental landscape, and talks about some of the ancient understandings of chi.
teaser: Architect Tom Bender discusses using space in a sacred way, and paying attention to chi (life force), which permeates everything.

title: Carol Ritberger on Medical Intuition
body:
Medical intuitive Carol Ritberger discusses the near-death experience that enabled her to see the human energy system (aura), and how she learned to identify energy blockages that affect wellness.

Carol Ritberger helps clients understand how emotional, psychological, and spiritual energy imbalances can be the root cause of illness, disease, and life crises.
teaser: Medical intuitive Carol Ritberger discusses the near-death experience that enabled her to see the human energy system (aura), and how she learned to identify energy blockages that affect wellness.

title: Amazon John Easterling on Amazon Herbs
body:
John Easterling (Amazon John) discusses how he first started an import business and how serious illness exposed him to the knowledge of a local medicine man and the incredible herbal concoctions that have been part of rainforest tribal life for centuries. He has been to the Amazon about 300 times and continues to help create the financial ability for the local tribes to survey, stake and ultimately own the forests that they have been living in. This results in some families owning 13,000 acres of lush bio-diverse land that can legally be kept from the logging and farming companies. Now, John helps the local people cultivate their land to provide sources of herbs rich in nutrients and vital to human health.

John’s company, The Amazon Herb Company, provides a circle of benefit that is truly inspiring. The money earned by Amazon Herbs is distributed to everyone involved in cultivating the herbs, distributing them and providing them to the public through independent distributors.
teaser: John Easterling (Amazon John) discusses how he first started an import business and how serious illness exposed him to the knowledge of a local medicine man and the incredible herbal concoctions that have been part of rainforest tribal life for centuries.

title: Steven Ross on the Royal Rife Story
body:
Steven Ross, founder of the World Research Foundation, discusses Royal Rife and the history of his controversial  microscope and technology. The World Research Foundation locates, gathers, codifies, evaluates, classifies and disseminates information dealing with health and the environment. 

Royal Rife and Rife technology has been hotly debated over the decades and few have the real inside information. Steven has the whole story and dispels some myths and urban legends. He also explains why the Rife machines sold today are probably scams.

At the end of his life Royal was a penniless drunk, abandoned by his former medical friends. He met John Crane, to whom he gave his information and microscope. Crane asked Steven to take the microscope and get it working again but later, with card flashing lawyers, took it all back.
teaser: Steven Ross, founder of the World Research Foundation, discusses Royal Rife and the history of his controversial microscope and technology.

title: James Barrett on The Silent Gospel
body:
One of the great mysteries of the world has been the Shroud of Turin, in which the image of a man many believe is Jesus is, in effect, burned into a piece of cloth. James Barrett has spent the last seven years researching the scientific data that’s been gathered on the shroud and has expanded the research to include ancient spiritual technologies. The result of this melding of science and spiritual wisdom is the discovery of a signature frequency of the human heart that enables ascension – the frequency of compassion.

James Barrett is the author of the book, The Silent Gospel: The Science of Divinity – Creation of the Shroud of Turin.
teaser: The result of James Barrett’s seven-year melding of science and spiritual wisdom is the discovery of a signature frequency of the human heart that enables ascension – the frequency of compassion.

title: Edward Group on Total Health
body:
Naturopathic doctor, Edward Group III, has been studying natural health practices for over 20 years. In this interview, he gives you a prescription for how to take care of your immune system by taking care of your guts. He holds nothing back in telling us the source of our health issues including the overload of toxins in our diets.  Many of the color cleansers on the health food shelves may create more health issues for your colon.

Dr. Group founded Global Healing Center in 1998 and is currently the Chief Executive Officer.  Heading up the research and development team, Dr. Group assumes a hands-on approach in producing new and advanced degenerative disease products and information.  A decorated member of the Armed Forces, Dr. Group received two Army achievement medals—a good conduct medal and an overseas ribbon—and was honorably discharged from active duty in 1989.  During his service in the US Army Dr. Group developed a genuine desire to help and heal those around him.
teaser: Dr. Group has studied natural healing methods for over 20 years and now teaches individuals and practitioners all around the world.  He no longer sees patients but solely concentrates on spreading the word of health and wellness to the global community.

title: Christine Arena on High Purpose Companies 2
body:
Christine Arena is the author of The High-Purpose Company: The Truly Responsible (and Highly Profitable) Firms that are Changing Business Now, discuses corporate social responsibility (CSR).

Companies do not have to sacrifice doing well by doing good, and the companies who are investing in the environment may surprise you.
teaser: Christine Arena is the author of The High-Purpose Company: The Truly Responsible (and Highly Profitable) Firms that are Changing Business Now, discuses corporate social responsibility (CSR).

title: John Demartini on The Heart of Love
body:
In this interview John pulls no punches on the subject of true love. In his new book, The Heart of Love: How to Go Beyond Fantasy to Find True Relationship Fulfillment, John sorts through the difference between infatuation and unrealistic expectations and genuine partnership. In the end, he says, true love is about balance—the dance between the dark and the light.

Having been featured in The Secret, John’s message is now getting ever widening audiences and his work is truly profound in its simplicity.
teaser: Dr. John Demartini, author of The Heart of Love: How to Go Beyond Fantasy to Find True Relationship Fulfillment, sorts through the difference between infatuation and unrealistic expectations and genuine partnership.

title: Burton Goldberg on Alternative Medicine (part 2)
body:
In the second part of our interview with Burton Goldberg we continue to learn about the advances in alternative health and healing in the treatment of cancer. It is important to know that the FDA does not allow alternative treatments to say that they can ‘cure’ cancer. Are they just protecting their buddies in the pharmaceutical industrial complex? Or are they looking out for our best interests?

Burton has testified in front of Congress to no avail because of the power of the lobbyists in Washington, the men and women who are totally focused on creating wealth for our medical care providers and the drug companies that provide the drugs. The question we should all be asking is how to unplug from this system and learn to take care of ourselves without drugs. Burton challenges us all to have the knowledge and courage to unplug.
teaser: The conversation with Burton Goldberg continues to talk about some of the health issues that have to be talked about, and what may help to both prevent and reverse cancer.

title: Harry Oldfield on Our Invisible Universe
body:
Imagine if you could see illness in the body and its electrical field before it became a serious threat to your health. This is what Dr. Harry Oldfield brings to the world of medicine and healing.

Dr. Oldfield’s Polycontrast Interference Photography device (PIP) has aided healers and medical doctors alike in diagnosing illness, mental imbalances and more. PIP enables us to enter an otherwise invisible world of energy surrounding people, places, plants and animals, and to approach the mysterious subject of crystal healing.
teaser: Imagine that you could see illness in the body and its electrical field before it became a serious threat to your health. This is what Dr. Harry Oldfield brings to the world of medicine and healing.

title: Brian Dailey on Sound Healing, Modern and Holistic Health
body:
Dr. Brian Dailey discusses the different modalities he uses in his complimentary medical and healing practice.

Brian Dailey, M.D., FACEP, FACFE, is an Attending Physician in Emergency Medicine at Rochester General Hospital, Rochester, NY. Dr. Dailey is also a third degree Reiki Master with extensive experience in energetic and vibrational medicine, including the use of crystals, color, and sound therapy (including Hemi-Sync frequencies to induce altered states).

Dr. Dailey has been awarded Physician of the Year three times in a row.
teaser: Dr. Brian Dailey discusses the different modalities he uses in his complimentary medical and healing practice.

title: Christine Page on Intuition and Spiritual Alchemy
body:
After 30 years of medicine, Dr. Christine Page shares her profound understanding of spiritual alchemy and integrative medicine.
